website_summaries.verdict: Reusable K-Cups that are durable and fit most Keurig models that also come with a few concerns that are typical for products in this class.
pros: Classic design that's easy to use and clean
Fits most Keurig 2.0 and 1.0 coffee brewers
cons: Coffee has the tendency to come out weak
A few consumers had difficulties with the fit for some 2.0 models

customer_reviews.title: Worthless product.
customer_reviews.text: They don't fit. It's not clear in the product description that you had to add in a little piece to make it function with a Keurig 2.0 brewer and when I contacted the company about a refund, they refused to answer my question. So, while the box says 100% guarantee, I'm stuck with four pods that don't work.
customer_reviews.author: BKWordNerd

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed that these K cups do not work with my keurig. The ad and the booklet that came in the box clearly shows the k200 being compatible but I get a "this pod wasnt designed for this brewer" error message. I noticed that other reviewers mentioned they received a little purple piece which is supposed to be installed in the keurig machine. I did not receive that piece in my box and my box was sealed. Per the other reviewer, that piece makes that error message go away. Unfortunately it doesn't look like they give you that piece anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy T.

customer_reviews.title: MAKES WEAK COFFEE
customer_reviews.text: The problem I have with this reusable K-Pods is that they make WEAK coffee -- No matter what type of grounds, grind or type of coffee I use (dark roast, medium roast, French, Sumatra, Colombian, etc.) I've tried all 4 pods for 2 weeks -- all led to unsuccessful results. And I really tried to make it work. The positives are it's made of good quality filter as grounds remain in the pod and doesn't spill onto the cup. It feels durable and closes properly (though I've only used them for 2 weeks). It's easy to clean -- just dump the grounds, rinse, dry and refill again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G

customer_reviews.title: A great idea for the environmentally-conscious
customer_reviews.text: A great idea for the environmentally-conscious! And buying coffee in bags is far cheaper than k-cups. These work very well - they do not drop grounds in coffee (as some reviewers have stated) if you fill them just right (to the black plastic at the top) and the coffee is strong! I use either the 8oz or bigger on my Keurig and they are both delicious cups of coffee, though each to their own. It definitely makes it stronger than k-cups! The only negative (& it's a small one) is that there is a little excess water/coffee once it's finished brewing, so a little paper towel is necessary to dab out the k-cup holder on the machine. LOVE this!
customer_reviews.author: Weldon Spring

customer_reviews.title: Best Reusable Kups ever!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I have used many different cups like this over the years of owning a Keurig. This one by far takes gold. One warning, dont put tea in this one as it filters quickly. All of the others that I have used in the past I could not put my favorite Gevalia french roast as it just backed up and would not filter. This one works very well and is super easy to clean. As I just purchased them and I have not had them very long I cannot attest to the longevity of the product, but it works very well with a fine and coarse ground coffee! I will be purchasing more when they wear out!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A. Raviele

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these to work so badly. My job has a Keurig machine and provides free DD K-cups for us. However, I loved the idea of being able to enjoy my favorite, freshly ground coffee while reducing my environmental impact. They unfortunately never worked in the Keurig machine. From the moment I inserted the cups into the machine, it gave me error messages. The machine recognized that it was not a Keurig product.
customer_reviews.author: NAD

customer_reviews.title: I am not happy. I ordered a Keurig filter made for the ...
customer_reviews.text: After using it I noticed a black residue at the bottom of my cup of coffee. I used it a few more times and noticed that when the water goes into the filter, the coffee grounds rise to the top and come out of the hole on top of the filter and get the space around where the filter sits nasty. I am not happy. I ordered a Keurig filter made for the model that I have. Should have done it out of the gate and not wasted my time on these. Would not recommend these filters.
customer_reviews.author: Irish gal

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try these after reading the first few good reviews. When I got it my Keurig 2.0 was giving me a message that the k cup was incompatible with the machine. I read more reviews where people said you had to trick it in some fashion to get it to work, which I eventually did, but then the coffee was super watery. So now I've wasted time and money on unusable k cups as well as wasted some of my really nice coffee grounds. Don't be like me. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Convenient and Works!
customer_reviews.text: These work PERFECTLY in a Keurig coffee maker and they are much easier to use than the k-cup holder that requires you to take the widget out of the coffeemaker first. These are used just like a k-cup--fill and use, then rinse. They've held up well. It comes with 4 so you can have them at work, at home, for camping and a spare. I recommend this product highly if you want to grind your own coffee but like the convenience of a Keurig or Keurig-type coffee maker. Easy clean-up.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, just doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is fantastic and works really well. My problem is, I like my coffee fairly strong, and no matter how much I put in of my favorite brew, it's never more that medium. I've tried several different fill levels and get the same result. However, when I brew in a drip machine, I get the strength I like. Odd. I don't blame the pod, I'm sure the problem is either with my coffee choice or amount. These pods fit perfectly, and clean up real nice. So I will continue to try, I'll even buy a different coffee and see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: T. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Makes weak coffee
customer_reviews.text: Allows too much water to go through too fast, so makes weak coffee. Those "dolphin" ones work better, and any pod with a solid bottom will work better. I'm not a heavy coffee drinker and it took a while to figure out how much coffee to use for best results, so wasn't sure it was the pods at first.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Cats

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality but not sure they'll fit every kuerig
customer_reviews.text: These didn't work in the single serve kuerig 2.0. And I use fake brand pods, so it's not the machine. I dunno, whatever. Just be warned... I did include pictures of my kuerig for reference. Oh, I also tried to use the pods with and without the center circle piece... It didn't make a difference :( At the same time, if your machine does accept these, they do seem like they're great quality for the price. I wish they had worked for me but they were returned instead.
customer_reviews.author: Miss PeabodiTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great if you like sludge, coffee flavored water, and a gigantic mess to clean up
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these. I can't understand why they are mesh up the sides where all the water leaks out before even getting much contact with the coffee grounds. It leaks all over while brewing the coffee and quickly just turns into mostly water halfway through the process. It also leaves a sludge in the bottom of the cup because it doesn't filter the small particles well enough. If I can, I'm going to return these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with K10
customer_reviews.text: These don't work with the basic K10 mini model. I mean, they'll fit in the hole and all, but your coffee will come out soooo dilute that you might as well give up. I suspect there isn't enough pressure buildup inside of the cup to ensure proper extraction - you will notice that the original k cups only have a tiny hole at the bottom for the coffee to flow out of. These reusable cups are mostly made of permeable mesh so the water comes out as soon as it gets in and doesn't have time to extract the coffee. Do yourself a favor and invest into something more useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jairo

customer_reviews.title: Not great but not bad
customer_reviews.text: You have to use KCUP filters or you end up having turkish coffee. The alternative is grinding the beans more course but then you lose out on flavor. Honestly I think this is a lazy way of doing coffee and its also not the correct way if you know of and are use to pour over using paper filters. I think its better to stick with a v-style dripper and just use the machine for hot water IMO. While using the machine to produce coffee works, its not nearly as good as the v-style pour over method. Period.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned these since January. I’ve never been able to get them to work. Have used several different Keurigs and these simply don’t work. They spew water, will but coffee grinds in your coffee, or the coffee will be watered down. I’m confident I have the brain capacity to figure things out. Apparently not enough to get these to work. Maybe another brand is more successful, but these don’t even seem to fit in the machine. They’re always super snug and that’s probably why the water is always spewing over. Do not waste your money on these. Nice thought on paper, terrible in practice.
customer_reviews.author: Jae Mart

customer_reviews.title: Great Great Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried when I purchased these. Judging from some of the reviews I was scared they'd overflow or leave grounds in the cup. But I ordered them anyway because they were the highest rated at the best price. To my surprise, these are EXCELLENT quality and I have had no issues with overflowing or grounds with my K 40. I couldn't recommend these enough. Not only are they financially a better option, but they're better for the environment than disposable k cups. These cups are the best thing I've ever purchased on Amazon. I'm NEVER buying disposable k cups EVER AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: This would not be a bad product but the o-ring in the outter lid pops ...
customer_reviews.text: This would not be a bad product but the o-ring in the outter lid pops out when emptying. Be careful as it won't brew properly without that o-ring.
customer_reviews.author: Eudaemonia

customer_reviews.title: Had for a month and 2 of them already broke - still work though
customer_reviews.text: Glad I don't have to pay $1.50 for K cups anymore and can just put my own coffee in them. Way better than the k cups anyways. Never know how long the coffee has been in them and just doesn't taste like actual coffee! Addition to original review - while they work good, the tops of 2 of them are already hanging by a thread and will fall off soon. I do think they will still stay on when used but not great that something broke a month after we purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Works well with finer ground coffee otherwise weak
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help with the expense of buying cake cups all the time. I like the Boulder coffees like French roast, Starbucks dark coffee’s. I tried using Folgers regular and it seemed awful week. I bought a bag of Starbucks coffee brown o I bought this to help with the expense of buying cake cups all the time. I like the Boulder coffees white French roast, Starbucks dark copies. I tried using Folgers regular and it seemed awful week. I bought a bag of Starbucks coffee - Verona, and it works just fine. I think it’s probably because copies ground up a little finer than a regular folders or metal house. Looking forward to continued with this.
customer_reviews.author: WAM

customer_reviews.title: Great design and eay to clean.
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased to replace some other ones that I have had for about 2 years (from a different maker.) What an improvement in product design. The mesh on these well designed K-cups captures 100% of the coffee grounds but is easier to clean than the ones I had before. The opening at the top allows water to flow freely through without having coffee slush come back up. My GF and I split these half at her place half at mine.
customer_reviews.author: Gator Guy

customer_reviews.title: They work well, make coffee great using your ground coffee beans
customer_reviews.text: They fit my Keurig single serving clone machine and allow me to make really great coffee using my own grounds and not having to pay exorbitant prices for the K-cups. Also, almost no waste. Used coffee grounds go in the garden. Some complain about the process of emptying the used coffee grounds from the K-cup container. After the grounds are somewhat dried out, just hold the open reusable K-cup over a container to catch the coffee grounds and WHACK the bottom of the K-cup with a wooden spoon or(??) and usually the grounds come out first try. the K-cups are pretty tough and I have not damaged one yet.
customer_reviews.author: brooks w booker III

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive keurig coffee
customer_reviews.text: I like coffee and with the reusable cups it is much less expensive. I advise that you use them with unbleached filters (available from several sellers on Amazon) to eliminate the coffee residue in the bottom of your cup. I buy coffee beans and grind my own. I look for Rain Forest Alliance certified shade grown and fair trade coffee beans. I counter-balance the extra expense by using these reusable cups. Another benefit is that it makes it easy to compost the coffee (both coffee and filters can be composted). All in all, these reusable cups and the unbleached filters make coffee drinking an earth-friendly activity.
customer_reviews.author: Gunslinger

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best reusable cup I've tried
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best reusable cup I've tried, and I've tried plenty, even two of the official Keurig reusable products. Now, I've given it 5 stars because of how good, and clear of grounds, the coffee turned out. But also because these are by far the easiest cups to clean, of any I've had. The only thing I can't be sure of, is their longevity. Up until now, my favorite reusable cup were ones from EkoBrew. They have great longevity and are very good at everything, but harder to clean. Even if they don't last years, these are well worth this price ($8.95 for 4).
customer_reviews.author: The Dean

customer_reviews.title: Saves Me Money!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for two years now and let me tell you these are so durable that I still have three in the box that are unused. I use this about daily too. If you have a heavy coffee drinker in your family that could also save some money with their coffee habit I highly suggest these. Very easy to clean too. Just turn it upside down over a trash can and smack the bottom to dump out to grounds. Then take it to the sink and while upside down run it under the stream of water so the pressure from the water pushes out the remaining coffee grains down the sink. Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.author: Duston Ward

customer_reviews.title: Your results might be different?  We may not have the same machine.
customer_reviews.text: We recieved a Keurig as a gift recent. I have heard many things in terms of what kind of coffee to get and how you grind it. We just filled this thimble looking filter with coffee from a local shop. The coffee that came out was pretty good. That's all I really cared about. Didn't have any issues. Im not a fancy coffee guy. I just wanted something that gets the job done. This product performed admirably for my needs. Hope you find this review with photos useful.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie N

customer_reviews.title: Useless after flimsy tabs comes off!
customer_reviews.text: I brought these to add to my collection of other brands. I liked the colors , so I went with it. Big mistake. After only two uses the purple rim on the cup came off. No biggie I thought until I tried to use it (broken) and I got a pop up message saying the cup/filter isn’t compatible with the machine! The cups do not work with out the little purple thingy, which comes off very easy. I now have two broken. What’s more annoying is, I don’t even see the purpose of the purple piece. It’s unnecessary. I have other filters brought on Amazon that do not have that stupid piece and they still work good as new!
customer_reviews.author: Reggae

customer_reviews.title: Fits Keurig Elite
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted these for coffee he likes that we can't find in a kcup. We tried the Keurig brand My K cup and it was hard to use to be honest. These are so simple! You just open the lid, put in your coffee and stick it in your Keurig machine. We have the Keurig Elite and it fits perfect. No problem at all. We are very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Need more of a LIP to empty
customer_reviews.text: We usually make our own with the coffee grounds and while this one keeps less grounds out, opening these can be a pain. You have to get the right lip to open the basket or you have to keep trying and it can be frustrating. If you happen to leave the cup full of coffee grounds (like running to work quickly, or tending to children), I find you will have a hard time emptying out the grounds even after running hot water over them. No idea how to correct it, but these are our experiences with these cups.
customer_reviews.author: VaidyaFamily

customer_reviews.title: REUSABLE K-CUPS ARE GREAT
customer_reviews.text: We have a rather large amount of coffee purchased before we bought a Keurig and it would have been a shame to throw it away. So we purchased six reusable K-pods and fill them with the leftover grounds. The pods works equally well with the branded and single use pods and makes an excellent brew. It took a few tries before learning how to open the top of the new pods. (Put your thumb on the side opposite the hinge and the cover pops right up. Glad to recommend the product and the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FITS THE BUNN MY CAFE K-CUP DRAWER!!
customer_reviews.text: $ave a lot of $$$ with these. The main reason I purchased this particular brand of cup is because it fits the Bunn My Cafe coffee machine's K-cup drawer. NOT all reusable k-cups do. Most reusable k-cups have a completely flat, solid bottom and will not fit the Bunn drawer. But these have a bottom that is recessed up a good quarter of an inch (see the picture up close.) This allows them to fit perfectly into the Bunn My Cafe k-cup drawer. Now instead of buying pre-packaged k-cups, I can buy 'whatever' bag of coffee I choose, fill up these reusable cups, place them in an air tight canister and enjoy coffee at a savings.
customer_reviews.author: MikeL

customer_reviews.title: Watery coffee- don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Keurig a couple of weeks ago. While they’re easy to clean and use, the coffee always comes out watery. When using the disposable, pre-filled K-cups from the grocery (so bad for the environment... at least some companies make them recyclable), it makes the perfect cup. I’ve tried them with various coffees and ground fineness, and these never make anything stronger than coffee flavored water.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney E. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Love them. This is my second batch!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome. A couple of tricks: use a slightly coarser grind for minimal silt. With regards to cleaning: let them dry for a few days, then just open them up and pour the used grounds right out. If you can't wait, open the cup and turn it upside down over your trash can, and then whack the bottom (which is now facing up) with a tablespoon. That will knock the grounds right out. Either way, then a quick rinse under the faucet and you are good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Larson

customer_reviews.title: Good while  they last
customer_reviews.text: They work great for both types of Keurig and without any hard line inside like the Keurig brand, you can pack a bit more if you like. However, already one of the lids has broken from repeated use - the lid is held on by a plastic lid to body piece that wears easily from the usage tensions of open/clean/fill/close /repeat. 2 of the 4 the rings came off because they are just tacked on and it is easy to catch that ring(to activate the sensor in the Keurig) more often than the edge of the lid you have to pull up. Great for awhile and really cheap, er inexpensive!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kerr

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I did a comparison to these versus the other versions that have a closed in base; these produce more coffee "mud" and have a more hollow flavor. These to allow for a producing a faster cup of coffee, however that mostly due to the reduced resistance of the filter, hence less stay time of the water in the grounds - which I suspect leads to the less rich, more hollow tasting cup of coffee for the same amount of grounds. They do the job, but not as good as the solid base cups.
customer_reviews.author: Ron G

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: What I like about these is the mesh/screen is fine enough that I don’t have coffee grounds in my coffee. That has been a problem with some I have used in the past. The thing I don’t like about these, it’s hard to find the front on the little lid to open. I almost ripped off the hinge trying to get it opened. I think I’m just going to get a black sharpie and put a dot on the top so I can easily tell where the front is. But I really like the way these filter the water through and not the coffee! I have a sharpie so that’s an easy fix..
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as additional replacements for my K-cup. I wanted more than just 1 K-cup between 2 coffee drinkers in the house. The fine mesh keeps the coffee grinds from getting into the coffee. However, the top is a bit flimsy + doesn't snap shut as tightly as another replacement that I bought in a local store for much more money. Additionally, 2 of the six tops have already separated from the cups. They are only 2 months old at the time of this review. That is why I rated a 3.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Updated review: not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a number of reusable Keurig filters, and these are by far the best. Work perfectly (Keurig 1.0), and clean up super-quick and easy. Price is very reasonable. UPDATE: They were great UNTIL the little cap in the center of the top began falling out. If you aren't careful, you will lose them in the trash as you empty the grounds. This has happened to all four of the cups. Without the cap in place, water squirts out the sides and misses your coffee cup.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Logan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap way to make a coffee sprinkler
customer_reviews.text: They do not work in my machine. I have tried every recommended fix to keep it from leaking and shooting coffee out of the machine when it increases pressure at the end of the cycle. They just flat out do not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I use these guys everyday for my coffee and they have yet to break. They fit in my keurig, I don't get grounds in my coffee and I don't have to feel bad about wasting plastic like normal K cups. They are a little messy to clean but if you rinse them right after use with warm water it makes clean up a lot easier. I've already recommended them to my friends and I would definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Seller sent wrong item. Otherwise the cups work great!
customer_reviews.text: These are great.... normally. Sadly the last order, this seller sent a 2-pack instead of four. The box was stuffed with a small pack of paper filters to fill the space. Not happy with that. The four pack I had ordered previously have held up pretty well, but one of the cups' lid hinge broke. The lid will stay on, but sad it broke within a couple month's use. The other three worked great for almost six months now. Our family goes through a lot of coffee, so having to share four cups leaded to the need for another package.
customer_reviews.author: AM PhotoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Yar
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a few months ago and I'm on the second one of the pack. The first one lasted awhile, and it is still usable but the lid seperated from the container. If i had to guess, this four pack will last me a year if not a little more. And i drink several cups of coffee in the morning. Worth every penny, way cheaper than purchasing k-pods. I'm really into recycling, and hated that the pods were not recyclable. I felt guilty throwing away 3 or 4 almost every day. Really glad i purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: Reusable Single Cup Keurig Solo Filter
customer_reviews.text: I purchase the 6 pack of reusable single cup Keurig Solo Filters. The first one I used the screen part let go, it creates an opening and all the coffee grounds end up in the cup of coffee, so I could no longer use it. Just recently a second Keurig Solo Filter did the same thing, the screen part that meets the plastic pulled away, another one in the trash. We have 4 more to go.
customer_reviews.author: William W Allen

customer_reviews.title: Green approach to brewing in the Keurig--may need to shift to more coarsely ground coffee beans
customer_reviews.text: The reusable cups are great and reduce the amount of materials we recycle on a weekly basis. The only problem we have encountered is that we may need to purchase more coarsely ground coffee, as there is sediment in the bottom of each cup of coffee. We will try moving to more coarsely ground coffee beans before resorting to purchasing filters to place in the reusable cups.
customer_reviews.author: REBECCA L WATTS

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: These reusable cups are much better than ones I had previously bought. They fit directly into my (aging) Cuisinart Keurig-compatible coffee maker without having to insert the adapter. They empty easily and rinse out clean. I am gentle with opening/closing the lid as it is a one-piece molding. That may be key to them lasting awhile. When filled, they create a good strong cup of coffee. Do expect, however, to find some small amount of sludge at the bottom of your cup. That doesn't bother me. All in all, a good product at a more-than-fair price. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Koop

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I bought a single reusable filter pod in a retail store and it was a pain to use because it had a separate lid to attach/lock, the bottom of it didn't lay flat on the counter and I had to take the cartridge out of the Kuerig to use it. These are easy to fill, have a flat bottom and pop right in to the existing cartridge. Plus I can fill a couple up the night before, they fit in my K-cup carousel and they are ready to go in the morning. Love them! Made my mornings easier!
customer_reviews.author: andyzewski

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as name brand.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I almost sent them back because my machine said they didn't work. I didn't realize there was a tiny purple plastic piece that you need to insert into the Keurig in order for it to read the cups properly. Screw Keurig trying to make you buy their own over priced crap. These work perfectly and cost much less. After a few months the lids fell off, because the plastic hinge breaks. However the name brand cups did the exact same. There are some generic purple ones I bought that are super thick and have the best hinges. Those are still intact.
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo

customer_reviews.title: We didn't buy a Kuerig until we discovered these reusable filters!
customer_reviews.text: We didn't buy a Kuerig until we discovered these! We have long ground our own blends of very excellent coffee, and (we believe) wisely choosen to spend money on things other than the pre-filled, disposable coffee cups (half-a-buck or more). That quickly adds up to the cost of a daily visit to a coffee house, a thousand bucks plus annually! Your reusable cups allow us Kuerig convenience with our own blends and at an excellent cost level.
customer_reviews.author: Piet

customer_reviews.title: They don’t end up in a landfill after one use!
customer_reviews.text: I use these so that I don’t have to add the disposable k cups to the local landfill. I use the degradable filters and throw the filter and the coffee grounds in the garden where they decompose. I have been using these for the last four years and would never go back to the one time use k cups again. I have 11 of these and so I do not have to refill them that often. I drink two cups of coffee a day. We all need to do our part for our planet!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry L.

customer_reviews.title: Finally can brew coffee I like, spend far less, and can quickly clean them.
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient and allow me to use all traditional coffee brands. I have never been able to find a one-time use cup that didn't leave me at least a tiny bit disappointed. The only downside is that, unless I use the special filters designed for k-cups, I end up with very fine coffee grinds in my mug. It was worst during the first half dozen times I used them and got better over time but still leaves a small amount at the bottom of my mug. I experienced similar results in some of the one-time-use k-cups so I won't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: A little extra effort
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning requires extra effort, it makes these a bit less convenient than the standard pods. But with these you can use any coffee, even fresh ground stuff. After use I tend to set them aside for a day or two to dry, it makes the coffee or tea a bit easier to dumb out, and rinse the rest out. A small amount of effort yields a great benefit to reducing the pod waste. The spent coffee is easy to collect for the garden this way too.
customer_reviews.author: Bhosley

customer_reviews.title: Like the versatility of using this refillable K-cup
customer_reviews.text: I am new to the world of Keurig. It has been a learning curve trying the different coffees to see what I like best. I have found that the exact same product can taste differently due to the delivery system. For example, I think a brewed cup of Starbucks ground Caffe Verona in the reusable K-Cup tastes better (to me) than the pre-filled K-Cups of the same product. Don't know why that is. So I am happy that I made this purchase, and use them every day.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy

customer_reviews.title: These are the best reusable Keurig filters
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased and used all kinds of reusable filters for my Keurig and these ones are (by far) the best. The best part is the large section of screen that allows the water to flow through the coffee. Others only have small openings which are harder to clean and sometimes cause leakage in the unit. These pods are mostly screen which makes them easier to brew and clean. They are also durable. If you are looking for resusable Keurig filters, I highly recommend these ones.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: it works as expected 4.5 and not 5 as randomly water leaks
customer_reviews.text: It is not as clean as the originals and it is not all the time, it is just water not big deal but didn't see mentioned any where. You will save a ton of money and help the environment. Something good is that you can fit the perfect flavor (stronger or lighter) based on the quantity of coffee you use. The sky is the limit in terms of variety of coffee or tea you can use. I use it with the paper filters so is easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Madrigal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy, can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Just do not filled to the top. Only filled to the top of the screen otherwise you may get coffee grounds into your cup. I also bought the scoop that was offered with it and that is awesome. Again do not overfill. I am going to buy a cheap package of K-cups just to see how much coffee are actually inside one of the K-Cups because my cup of coffee now seems stronger than normal. Some people may like that. I bought these to save money from buying cases and cases of K-cups and so far they're working out awesome
customer_reviews.author: Edward Lufkin

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an economic answer to purchasing the K-Cups. This allows you to use standard coffee grounds in a Keurig coffee machine. Essentially, you place the desired amount of coffee in the cup, a K-Cup size, and place the container in the K-cup receptacle on your Keurig. Working identical to the K-Cup, this product is great and highly economical. The only reason the product is not 5-stars, is the hinge is weak and oftentimes breaks; however, you can still use the product even after the hinge breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Franz B

customer_reviews.title: They work as good as can be expected from a reusable filter.
customer_reviews.text: These brew coffee through our machine. I am not normally a fan of the Keurig set up but I only have 1 coworker and she prefers it. I can drink my brand with these which is great. It does brew more sediment than the disposables but it's a trade off that isn't too bad. I use a drip coffee maker at home but am trying to cut back at work so these help me drink what I really enjoy but in a controlled portion.
customer_reviews.author: BeckJ

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These reusable cups are great for home and for office, if there aren't many people using the Keurig. I find them easier to clean if I let them dry out for a few hours because then I can pour out the dried coffee grounds. Some grounds stick to the screen, but it's easy to tap out before washing. I feel much better using and reusing these than the non-recyclable, non-compostable disposable K-Cups. I bought one set for the office for communal use, and one more set for home once we got a Keurig unit.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Filters
customer_reviews.text: I really like these filters. I have used other filters, The problem that i've had with other filters is that the bottom of the filter is flat. If it isn't inserted correctly, it will punch a hole at the bottom of the filter. Over time, you may have a lot of coffee grounds floating in your cup. These filters sit a little higher with a space at the bottom. If you insert the filter the wrong way, it does not sit low enough to punch a hole in it.
customer_reviews.author: S.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great reusable K cups
customer_reviews.text: I really like these reusable K cups so I can use my own coffee. I did find that I needed a paper filter with it since coffee grinds kept ending up in my coffee. I purchased these little filters that really made this work well.  I have only used one of the 4 cups and it has held up well for about 40 cups of brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Vykon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Kcup replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchases a keurig coffee maker but have been on the fence for a long time because I knew how expensive the kcups were. Super easy and convenient but can get pricey after a while. Plus, I had a ton of ground coffee stockpiled in the kitchen that I still had to use. Enter the reusable kcups! my friend recommended these and I have not looked back since! Cleaning it is pretty easy too. I just empty it out and rinse it
customer_reviews.author: Johanna S.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, flimsy lids
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these, but unfortunately they aren't going to be a long lasting item. The cup itself is sturdy and very easy to clean. The lids, however, are really flimsy and aren't going to last long. The plastic is thin and the purple rings, which I assume tell the brewer that these are "legit" have already started cracking and will possibly just partially come off, which means the brewer will no longer accept them. They work. I just don't expect them to last.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Holt

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: A less expensive and less environmentally unfriendly way to use a Keurig. I have been using them for about a year and none have broken. There is a plastic hinge which will eventually fail. They were a bit of a challenge to open and close until I got the hang of it. All of the grounds need to be cleared from the rim before closing. I had to stare at the rim to make sure than I was prying up the correct layer to open.
customer_reviews.author: dkt56

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, good for 12 oz. of beverage
customer_reviews.text: I really like these filter pods because 1.I don't have to take apart my Keurig to use them, they just slip right in the machine. 2. They are really easy to clean; just dump and rinse. and 3. I can pack enough ground Starbucks into them to make a really good 12 oz. cup of coffee. The ready packed K-cups get too dilute for 12 oz. These are winners!
customer_reviews.author: J. Frazee

customer_reviews.title: These Reusable K-Cups Are Still Great, 2 Years Later!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two 4-Pks of these reusable/refillable K-Cups 2 years ago. They make a perfect 12 ounce cup of coffee! A year ago, I decided to use paper filters with these, just to make cleanup easier/quicker. I've always washed them by hand, which I'm sure aids in their longevity. I bought these from the iPartsPlusMore retailer here on Amazon. I highly recommend them (seller & product)!
customer_reviews.author: Smiliesim

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied that not a single lid would stay closed ...
customer_reviews.text: Very dissatisfied that not a single lid would stay closed on any of the six cups, with or without any ground coffee in the cups.
customer_reviews.author: Research is my thing

customer_reviews.title: Finicky and somewhat annoying
customer_reviews.text: Getting these to work in my Keurig is a pain. The Keurig doesn't want to accept them and repeatedly gives me an error message that says these are not compatible. Eventually, if a turn the pod, jiggle it around, and open and close the Keurig about 19x, it will work. My husband gets super aggravated. UPDATE: I increased my rating from 2 stars to 3. The issue resolved itself after a few weeks as the reusable cups became "broken-in." I rarely get the error message now. That said, it shouldn't be an issue at all. But it has gotten better.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Byrnes

customer_reviews.title: No more waste!!!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is one of my favorite purchases of late. 1. because i have eliminated the waste of K-Cups. 2. I can go back to getting really good, fresh coffee, 3. They are well made and durable and the pack comes with 4 cups. These do work with a Keurig 2.0 so they must have fixed that issue. They're easy to clean, I just dump out the old grains in the trash and wash it our quickly. Please switch to these for the environments sake and fresh coffee is just better than any K-Cup coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not a keurig product.
customer_reviews.text: This says “reusable k cups for keurig”, is it not the keurig brand. Once I put it in my keurig filled with coffee, the keurig won’t recognize it or actually make any coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Quit reading and buy it already.
customer_reviews.text: Eco friendly and great way to save money while drinking your favorite coffee or loose teas. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: E Sands

customer_reviews.title: Defective! Not compatible with Keurig 2.0!
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work with my Keurig 2.0. The website says it is compatible but it in fact is not. My Keurig works with a different brand of refillable k cups but not these. I ordered 6 pods and they did not work, I tried all 6 of them. I tried contacting the seller and they are only giving me a refund if I ship the defective items back to them. This is stupid because the k cups cost $11, and shipping the defective, un-usable cups back to the seller will waste half that money on shipping. I encourage other buyers to use caution with these, maybe consider a different brand rather than throw your money away.
customer_reviews.author: Sina

customer_reviews.title: Cup of grounds
customer_reviews.text: This is what I find with every refill product as of late. I bought one from Wegmans a couple yrs ago that was perfect until someone forgot to take out the holder with the needle and have yet to come across another. The shipping box comes with a card saying oh if you "don't want the grounds buy a filter for the cups?!" Why would I buy reusable filters to have to use paper filters? I will just start using my old pot and use paper filters! Who drinks coffee with grounds? How about a product that comes that works no added accessories?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use them all the time
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about them actually working in a Keurig machine but I have used them in 2 separate machines and they have worked no problem. I use them at work where we a Keurig in the break room, and I like to use my own loose tea. I'm also a huge fan of not throwing away a K cup every time I need a caffeine boost. They're easy to fill and easy to clean. I think in the long run this will save money and help keep K cups out of the trash.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Good strong coffee with the right roast
customer_reviews.text: I like a strong cup of coffee and these work great with a dark roast coffee. Fill loosely to the top of the mesh area and use a 4 or 8oz cup size. I use two separate cups and use the 8oz brew setting to fill my 20oz travel mug. The quality of the plastic is not that great so only time will tell how these hold up. Overall I consider these the perfect solution for someone that wants to use their own coffee and like a strong brew.
customer_reviews.author: Darbco

customer_reviews.title: High quality “cups” that also will save a lot of money by using your bulk coffee grounds.
customer_reviews.text: My new husband came complete with a Keurig, which I hated because I’m a coffee snob. When I accidentally broke the pot on my coffee machine and had a lot of delicious strong coffee grounds on hand, I bought these self fillable keurig cups and became a keurig fan. These “cups” are great!
customer_reviews.author: Marushka Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good if you drink weak coffee
customer_reviews.text: Probably fine if you like weak coffee. I was hoping for an eco-friendly alternative to the traditional k-cups and unfortunately these will not work for me. I would have to go through a full cup of grounds for each six ounces of coffee in order to get something approaching the correct strength of coffee, and that just doesn't work for me in the morning. Luckily, they were pretty cheap so it isn't much money lost. I wouldn't recommend it if you like strong coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: These work fine in my Kurig. You do have to install a purple little tab so they will work as Kurig scans the edge of the cups for color.Black doesn't work in kurig. Once installed any cup will work !! That's a good thing !! I do recommend using a paper filter in these for finer ground coffee. They can be bought at Walmart and work awesome to have less grounds in your coffee. The brand I got are called Brew&Save 100 little filters per box. I love using these cups as its so much cheaper and you can brew any ground coffee you want!!
customer_reviews.author: VIC

customer_reviews.title: They're okay.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't hold all the coffee These are nice and cost effective compared to the boxes of prepackaged coffee. I get larger pieces of coffee grounds through these filters when I use them. It usually settles at the bottom of my cup. They're okay, and get the job done. Better than spending a premium on prepackaged coffees, does reduce the clean expedience though
customer_reviews.author: BPM

customer_reviews.title: I love my Keurig but I don't love the pod idea
customer_reviews.text: I love my Keurig but I don't love the pod idea, both because of the masses of plastic it produces, the cost, and because I prefer to have more control over the quality of the coffee that goes in. These give me the option to control that and feel good about being environmentally responsible. And they're so inexpensive that I'm able to keep a fair number on hand so that I don't have to worry that I won't have a clean one. They're actually pretty easy to clean; I just forget to do it. Anyway, my verdict is: well made, well thought out, and available at a reasonable price. That gets five stars in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Antonia Levi

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to Keurig users!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase the above reusable k-cups for times when I use other coffees or when I run out of my regular k-cups. When I first put the reusable cup in the Keurig it didnn't fit right and I figured it would be going back, but much later when things were quiet and calm, I tried again and they fit perfectly. great to have in the house when you want to use other than the regular K-cup coffee. The cups came on time and packaged so they wouldn't be damaged. I would never hesitate to buy from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Braumuller

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, Inexpensive, Easy to use, Reusable filter pods
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the set of 4 Keurig compatible filter pods when I began using the Keurig coffee maker at work. I soon realized how expensive buying single serve k-cups were. Now I bring in my own coffee and make several cups of coffee a day without breaking the bank. They're very easy to use and have enough mesh on the sides and bottom to allow the water to filter through properly. The plastic cover is hinged and snaps closed in place. They fit the Keurig K50 as indicated perfectly. The coffee is ready in no time. Thanks for offering these pods.
customer_reviews.author: Swissmiss

customer_reviews.title: I love this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok I love my Keurig but I hated the idea of throwing those little cups away after every single use. Yes there are some that are recyclable but not all and not the coffee I like. So these little bad boys were a blessing and I get to enjoy whatever coffee I want and just pour my grounds in while my Keurig does the rest and no disposal is needed.
customer_reviews.author: LoVeRofBooks

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of Kuerig Compatibility issues
customer_reviews.text: These do not work for my kuerig 2.0. My wife actually cut the old foil cover off of a used K cup, placed it on top of the reuseable basket to get the kuerig to accept it and we were able to make it work. The kuerig does not recognize the baskets as compatible with their machine. The basket is well made, durable and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Marci H.

customer_reviews.title: Not So Good!
customer_reviews.text: The fit in my coffee maker is good, the lids stay closed, but the coffee is VERY WEAK AND TASTELESS. My other brand of reusable single-serve pods give me an excellent cup of coffee. I noticed that the mesh screening around the side of these pods is much larger than my original pods which makes me think that the water is flowing through too quickly, thus weak coffee. Not a good buy and I want a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Elle B.

customer_reviews.title: Go with the brand name
customer_reviews.text: The cups look like any other cup I've used but when running my keurig I found that the liquid doesn't come out in a straight stream like it should, but its squirting out from all around the bottom of the k-cup. making a mess. It also seems like it isn't allowing the machine to dispense all of the liquid so my coffee maker keeps leaking excess water from the keurig base. I wont be using them and I am a bit disappointed that Im stuck wtih 4 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jessika

customer_reviews.title: Good to have extras
customer_reviews.text: These fit in a variety of machines. I have a Keurig 2.0, and a Cuisinart, and they work in both. If you drop The factory Keurig pod, the top breaks easily, but while these seem lighter and more fragile, they bounce if dropped and survive perfectly. I got 3, so I can use one, clean it and use a second one for my next cup. I grind my own, so if you do that don’t grind it too fine (like espresso).
customer_reviews.author: iemusic

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising!! All 4 did not work with my Kureig 2.0 machine!!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointing that this product does NOT work with 2.0 kurieg machines!! Now I will have to go through the hassle of returning this item when it should have worked in the first place especially since the product details specifically mention this works for the 1.0 and 2.0 models. False advertising is not okay and if you say your product works with a certain machine it should! Otherwise I give 2 stars because the product itself is very well made and the mesh basket seems very durable and easy to clean. Wish I wasn't defrauded and the product worked as it said it would.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse V.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered my Keurig K55 I also ordered these reusable filter pods because I have unusual taste in coffee. These reusable pods permit me to enjoy freshly ground coffees that I would have otherwise been able to. The reusable pods are easy to use and I especially value the tight seal the top makes so as to avaoid fouling the works of the machine. Thank you for an excellent, reasonably priced addition to my coffee enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Mcguire

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP HINGE
customer_reviews.text: We have used this style for years, so much cheaper than buying k cups. originally I purchased a set from the grocery store and they lasted 5 years. I recently ordered these new K-Cups to replace a Amazon set that I was unhappy with. I searched for the highest review, I got the exact same set that I ordered previously that broke within months. The cup works great the hinge is cheap. I have no idea how these have such a high rating!!!
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and cute Reusable Cup 4 pack
customer_reviews.text: Cute little 4 pk of reusable cups. These arrived quickly and in perfect condition. I like having a 4 pack so 4 people can make a quick cup of coffee, or I can make 2 before washing out a cup. Once the grounds are dried Hours after making a cup, they fall right out making clean up much easier. That’s another reason I like having more than one. I don’t need to clean out the one I just used before making another cup. And it’s definitely more economical and environmentally friendly than the disposable K cups.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila R

customer_reviews.title: Great to have for Company and the environment
customer_reviews.text: who knew these even existed! these are great to have around for company if someone wants decaf or regular. Every so often, so one will bring you back a bag of coffee from Hawaii (my husbands boss) and he was so disappointed that we couldnt try due to the new pod machine. Fret no more, now we can try and it was delish! Have to pack the coffee in to get a good cup of java :-). Since most pods aren't recyclable, this is a great alternative for the environment.
customer_reviews.author: tlv15

customer_reviews.title: cuts the cost per cup back down due to being able to use bulk coffee- and better for the environment
customer_reviews.text: Corrects both of the 2 downsides of the whole Keurig concept... cuts the cost per cup back down due to being able to use bulk coffee- and better for the environment. Works great, I love them. Well made product. Edit: after less than 3 weeks of light use, probably 7 or 8 uses- one of the lids hinges has broken. The K Cup is still useable- but should not break after such little use.
customer_reviews.author: Warren James

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought these!
customer_reviews.text: i love this product! It fits beautifully in the k-cup holder, so you don’t have to change the adapter if you want to avoid using k-cups. I’m very glad I bought them. Good price, easy to use (but don’t overfill) , environmentally sound because you don’t have to throw out k-cup packaging, and economical because loose coffee or beans are less expensive than k-cups. I like these so much that I buy them as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Grandmother librarian

customer_reviews.title: Makes Subpar Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Flawed design. Not exactly sure what the issue is - possibly lets water through too fast. The result is weaker coffee with less flavor. I tested by brewing the same coffee using one of these and again using an Ecobrew metal reusable K-cup. Every time, no matter how much I fill them, the Ecobrew produced better coffee. If you don't care what your coffee tastes like and just need something cheap, I guess these will work. I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: slopo

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: I had one reusable k-cup that was mostly plastic. It was hard to dump and clean. I purchased these and now I don't even use my other one. I set this one out of the morning and let the coffee grounds dry throughout the day, I dump them at night with no problem and rinse it out so it's ready for the next morning. These are wonderful. No grounds in my cup and the water seems to filter through just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Ann Thomas

customer_reviews.title: ... I was looking for - these allow me to enjoy my favorite coffees from Hawai'i and Trader Joe's
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for - these allow me to enjoy my favorite coffees from Hawai'i and Trader Joe's, as well as recycle the grounds in my garden. Very easy to clean, durable and excellent value. Be sure to use a fine grind for coffee. I also use a separate set of these for loose tea and have had a comparable taste experience.
customer_reviews.author: HBGuy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love these. We recently got a Keurig and have a lot of tea bags already on hand so I take a tea bag, remove the paper tag, and insert the tea bag into this little reusable cup in the Keurig. It works perfectly. Some of my favorite teas are not available in Keurig cups at all so this is a great solution. These little mesh cups are easily cleaned by just a steam of water from the faucet. They are built to last, too.
customer_reviews.author: Betz

customer_reviews.title: Yes, I recommend these!
customer_reviews.text: These cups are much easier to clean and use than previous refillable cups that I purchased. It is quite easy to tap on the bottom and squeeze the sides to remove the grounds directly into the garbage. They rinse out easily and now I have extras. And it is much cheaper to use these than k-cups. I also purchase Amazon coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Ela

customer_reviews.title: NO Fuss Making my Own Blend!!
customer_reviews.text: This is what it should be like to brew my favorite. Just fill the pod, put into my Elite and brew!!!!! Easy to dump old grounds and clean, ready for next use. Why they show that other adapter that is a hassle to use is beyond me. So very happy with this and yes I highly recommend it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Open after Use
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of trouble opening these to empty used coffee grounds. The top stuck. I tried inserting a table knife, used thumb nail (broken nail results). There is a purple ring glued to the top -- I suppose to make a tight fit -- that comes loose from the rest of the lid. I'm giving up on them. I bought a stainless-steel cup. We'll see about that one.
customer_reviews.author: wosedwew

product_meta.title: Reusable K Cups For Keurig 2.0 & 1.0 Brewers Universal Fit For Easy To Use Refillable Single Cup Coffee Filters - Eco Friendly Stainless Steel Mesh Filter (Pack of 4)
feature_bullets: ⭐ COMPATIBLE WITH: Keurig 1.0, 2.0 (Older models sensors may not read the cups. Please return for prompt refund) Models: K200, K250, K300, K350, K360, K450, K460, K500, K550, K560, K15, K31, K40, K44, K45, K50, K60, K66, K70, K77, K80, K100, B31, B40, B44, B50, B60, B66, B70, B77, B100, B140, B200 As Well As: Keurig Elite, Select, Classic, Ultra, Special Edition, Ultimate, and Platinum. Breville K Cup, Mr. Coffee K Cup. Does not work with Keurig K400, Compact and Mini.
⭐ easy to use: our 4 pack Refillable K-Cups are hassle free and do not require swapping out the Keurig filter holder or tampering of any kind to fit seamlessly into every Keurig or any other brewer.

⭐ premium quality: these Keurig K-Cups are made from high quality materials, they are 100% BPA free with a food grade stainless steel mesh. Our kcup filter is 100% dishwasher safe. Unlike our competitors we offer a safe & easy way to make your own tea or coffee blend. Just slide it into the slot and follow the same steps you would with your prefilled K cup.

⭐ eco safe: Refillable K-Cups aren’t only excellent for you and your personal enjoyment, they are also extremely helpful to our planet. Help reduce your carbon footprint ♻ by re using your Refillable K-Cups all while enjoying your favorite Coffee ☕ brewed with the help of your Keurig machine.
⭐ Customer Support: We strive to provide unmatched customer service & support. We offer a no-questions asked 1-year policy along with Lifetime customer support for all purchases.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars11,767 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
